## Step 1: Clone the Repository

Start by cloning the repository from GitHub and installing the dependencies:

git clone git@github.com:peacoltrain/stats386_final_movies.git

cd stats386_final_movies

python3 -m venv .venv

source .venv/bin/activate

pip install -r requirements.txt  # or use `pip install -e



## Step 2: API Access

To collect the data you will need to create a TMDB API key

- Sign up at themoviedb.org
- Go to Settings > API > Create API Key
- Insert your API key into the .env file


## Step 3: API Data Collection

There are two scripts for collecting the data: 

### Collect TMDB Movie IDs

python src/stats386_final_movies/dataLoading/getMovieIDs.py


### Fetch Movie Metadata

python src/stats386_final_movies/dataLoading/getMovieData.py

This will generate: ids.txt - list of movie IDs and movies.json - full raw movie data (contains over 200,000 entries, (this will not be tracked in Git))

Collecting all of the data and full movie metadata will take 50+ hours due to API rate limits 

## Data Cleaning

Next, filter and clean the raw data to retain only relevant U.S. based movie information

python src/stats386_final_movies/dataLoading/clean_movie_data.py

This will create: cleaned_movies.json - the cleaned dataset of about ~3,500 movies

## Analysis & Visualization

Run the analysis script to generate summary statistics and visualizations:

python src/stats386_final_movies/analysis_and_visualization.py

This will: Print relevant stats about the dataset (average revenue, profit, etc...)

Generate plots of: Profit by year, Profit by genre, Top production companites by average profit


## Summary 

By following these steps, you can fully reproduce our data pipeline and run exploratory analysis on recent movie trends. 

The project includes data cleaning, analysis, and installable pythong package, and a full documentation and technical report
